{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|format}}
{{dcl|since=c++23|1=
template&lt; ranges::input_range R, class CharT &gt;
    requires (std::format_kind&lt;R&gt; != std::range_format::disabled) &amp;&amp;
              std::formattable&lt;ranges::range_reference_t&lt;R&gt;, CharT&gt;
struct formatter&lt;R, CharT&gt;;
}}
{{dcl h|Helper templates}}
{{dcl|notes={{mark expos}}|1=
template&lt; std::range_format K, ranges::input_range R, class CharT &gt;
struct /*range-default-formatter*/;
}}
{{dcl end}}

The template specialization of {{lc|std::formatter}} for the range types allows users to convert a range to its textual representation as a collection of elements or a string using [[cpp/utility/format|formatting functions]].

The specialization is derived from {{box/core|{{tti|range-default-formatter}}{{c/core|&lt;std::format_kind&lt;R&gt;, R, CharT&gt;}}}}.

The specialization is enabled if {{c|R}} satisfies {{lconcept|input_range}}, {{c|std::format_kind&lt;R&gt;}} is not {{c|std::range_format::disabled}}, and {{c|std::formattable&lt;ranges::range_reference_t&lt;R&gt;, CharT&gt;}} is {{c|true}}.

This specialization meets the {{named req|Formatter}} requirements if {{c|const R}} models {{lconcept|input_range}} and {{c|ranges::range_reference_t&lt;const R&gt;}} models {{c|std::formattable&lt;CharT&gt;}}. It always meets the {{named req|BasicFormatter}} requirements.

===Format specification===
The syntax of {{spar|range-format-spec}} is:
{{sdsc begin}}
{{sdsc|
{{spar optional|range-fill-and-align}} {{spar optional|width}} {{ttb|n}}{{mark optional}} {{spar optional|range-type}} {{spar optional|range-underlying-spec}}
}}
{{sdsc end}}

The syntax is fully described in {{rlpsd|range formatter#Range format specification}}.

For specializations of {{tt|std::formatter}} where {{c|std::format_kind&lt;R&gt;}} is either {{c|std::range_format::string}} or {{c|std::range_format::debug_string}}, the {{spar|format-spec}} is {{spar|std-format-spec}} instead of {{spar|range-format-spec}} (which uses {{c|std::formatter&lt;std::basic_string&lt;CharT&gt;, CharT&gt;}} as the underlying formatter).
